text: Ceratozamia miqueliana is a species of plant in the family Zamiaceae. It is endemic to Chiapas and Veracruz, Mexico. It is currently found in Coatzacoalcos and Santiago Tuxtla. Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests. It is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== miqueliana Category:Endemic flora of Mexico Category:Flora of Chiapas Category:Flora of Veracruz Category:Vulnerable plants Category:Endangered biota of Mexico Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Ceratozamia miqueliana
